tachyon.worker.block

Class BlockDataManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • tachyon.worker.block.BlockDataManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Testable<BlockDataManager>

    public final class BlockDataManager
extends Object
implements Testable<BlockDataManager>
    Class is responsible for managing the Tachyon BlockStore and Under FileSystem. This class is thread-safe.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BlockDataManager(WorkerSource workerSource, WorkerBlockMasterClient workerBlockMasterClient, WorkerFileSystemMasterClient workerFileSystemMasterClient, tachyon.worker.block.BlockStore blockStore)
      Creates a BlockDataManager based on the configuration values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BlockDataManager

        public BlockDataManager(WorkerSource workerSource,
                WorkerBlockMasterClient workerBlockMasterClient,
                WorkerFileSystemMasterClient workerFileSystemMasterClient,
                tachyon.worker.block.BlockStore blockStore)
                 throws IOException
        Creates a BlockDataManager based on the configuration values.
        Parameters:
        workerSource - object for collecting the worker metrics
        workerBlockMasterClient - the block Tachyon master client for worker
        workerFileSystemMasterClient - the file system Tachyon master client for worker
        blockStore - the block store manager
        Throws:
        IOException - if fail to connect to under filesystem

    • Method Detail

      • grantAccess

        public void grantAccess(Tester<BlockDataManager> tester)
        Specified by:
        grantAccess in interface Testable<BlockDataManager>

      • abortBlock

        public void abortBlock(long sessionId,
              long blockId)
                throws BlockAlreadyExistsException,
                       BlockDoesNotExistException,
                       InvalidWorkerStateException,
                       IOException
        Aborts the temporary block created by the session.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The id of the client
        blockId - The id of the block to be aborted
        Throws:
        BlockAlreadyExistsException - if blockId already exists in committed blocks
        BlockDoesNotExistException - if the temporary block cannot be found
        InvalidWorkerStateException - if blockId does not belong to sessionId
        IOException - if temporary block cannot be deleted

      • accessBlock

        public void accessBlock(long sessionId,
               long blockId)
                 throws BlockDoesNotExistException
        Access the block for a given session. This should be called to update the evictor when necessary.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The id of the client
        blockId - The id of the block to access
        Throws:
        BlockDoesNotExistException - this exception is not thrown in the tiered block store implementation

      • persistFile

        public void persistFile(long fileId,
               long nonce,
               String ufsPath)
                 throws TachyonException,
                        IOException
        Completes the process of persisting a file by renaming it to its final destination. This method is normally triggered from FileOutStream.close() if and only if UnderStorageType#isPersist() ()} is true. The current implementation of persistence is that through UnderStorageType operations write to UnderFileSystem on the client's write path, but under a temporary file.
        Parameters:
        fileId - a file id
        nonce - a nonce used for temporary file creation
        ufsPath - the UFS path of the file
        Throws:
        TachyonTException - if the file does not exist or cannot be renamed
        IOException - if the update to the master fails
        TachyonException

      • cleanupSessions

        public void cleanupSessions()
        Cleans up after sessions, to prevent zombie sessions. This method is called periodically by SessionCleaner thread.

      • commitBlock

        public void commitBlock(long sessionId,
               long blockId)
                 throws BlockAlreadyExistsException,
                        BlockDoesNotExistException,
                        InvalidWorkerStateException,
                        IOException,
                        WorkerOutOfSpaceException
        Commits a block to Tachyon managed space. The block must be temporary. The block is persisted after BlockStore.commitBlock(long, long). The block will not be accessible until WorkerBlockMasterClient.commitBlock(long, long, int, long, long) succeeds.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The id of the client
        blockId - The id of the block to commit
        Throws:
        BlockAlreadyExistsException - if blockId already exists in committed blocks
        BlockDoesNotExistException - if the temporary block cannot be found
        InvalidWorkerStateException - if blockId does not belong to sessionId
        IOException - if the block cannot be moved from temporary path to committed path
        WorkerOutOfSpaceException - if there is no more space left to hold the block

      • createBlock

        public String createBlock(long sessionId,
                 long blockId,
                 int tierAlias,
                 long initialBytes)
                   throws BlockAlreadyExistsException,
                          WorkerOutOfSpaceException,
                          IOException
        Creates a block in Tachyon managed space. The block will be temporary until it is committed.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The id of the client
        blockId - The id of the block to create
        tierAlias - The alias of the tier to place the new block in, -1 for any tier
        initialBytes - The initial amount of bytes to be allocated
        Returns:
        A string representing the path to the local file
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if location does not belong to tiered storage
        BlockAlreadyExistsException - if blockId already exists, either temporary or committed, or block in eviction plan already exists
        WorkerOutOfSpaceException - if this Store has no more space than the initialBlockSize
        IOException - if blocks in eviction plan fail to be moved or deleted

      • createBlockRemote

        public void createBlockRemote(long sessionId,
                     long blockId,
                     int tierAlias,
                     long initialBytes)
                       throws BlockAlreadyExistsException,
                              WorkerOutOfSpaceException,
                              IOException
        Creates a block. This method is only called from a data server. Call getTempBlockWriterRemote(long, long) to get a writer for writing to the block.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The id of the client
        blockId - The id of the block to be created
        tierAlias - The alias of the tier to place the new block in, -1 for any tier
        initialBytes - The initial amount of bytes to be allocated
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if location does not belong to tiered storage
        BlockAlreadyExistsException - if blockId already exists, either temporary or committed, or block in eviction plan already exists
        WorkerOutOfSpaceException - if this Store has no more space than the initialBlockSize
        IOException - if blocks in eviction plan fail to be moved or deleted

      • freeSpace

        public void freeSpace(long sessionId,
             long availableBytes,
             int tierAlias)
               throws WorkerOutOfSpaceException,
                      BlockDoesNotExistException,
                      IOException,
                      BlockAlreadyExistsException,
                      InvalidWorkerStateException
        Frees space to make a specific amount of bytes available in the tier.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - the session ID
        availableBytes - the amount of free space in bytes
        tierAlias - the alias of the tier to free space
        Throws:
        WorkerOutOfSpaceException - if there is not enough space
        BlockDoesNotExistException - if blocks can not be found
        IOException - if blocks fail to be moved or deleted on file system
        BlockAlreadyExistsException - if blocks to move already exists in destination location
        InvalidWorkerStateException - if blocks to move/evict is uncommitted

      • getTempBlockWriterRemote

        public BlockWriter getTempBlockWriterRemote(long sessionId,
                                   long blockId)
                                     throws BlockDoesNotExistException,
                                            IOException
        Opens a BlockWriter for an existing temporary block. This method is only called from a data server. The temporary block must already exist with createBlockRemote(long, long, int, long).
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The id of the client
        blockId - The id of the block to be opened for writing
        Returns:
        the block writer for the local block file
        Throws:
        BlockDoesNotExistException - if the block cannot be found
        IOException - if block cannot be created

      • getReport

        public BlockHeartbeatReport getReport()
        Gets a report for the periodic heartbeat to master. Contains the blocks added since the last heart beat and blocks removed since the last heartbeat.
        Returns:
        a block heartbeat report

      • getStoreMeta

        public BlockStoreMeta getStoreMeta()
        Gets the metadata for the entire block store. Contains the block mapping per storage dir and the total capacity and used capacity of each tier.
        Returns:
        the block store metadata

      • getVolatileBlockMeta

        public BlockMeta getVolatileBlockMeta(long blockId)
                               throws BlockDoesNotExistException
        Gets the metadata of a block given its blockId or throws IOException. This method does not require a lock ID so the block is possible to be moved or removed after it returns.
        Parameters:
        blockId - the block ID
        Returns:
        metadata of the block
        Throws:
        BlockDoesNotExistException - if no BlockMeta for this blockId is found

      • hasBlockMeta

        public boolean hasBlockMeta(long blockId)
        Checks if the storage has a given block.
        Parameters:
        blockId - the block ID
        Returns:
        true if the block is contained, false otherwise

      • lockBlock

        public long lockBlock(long sessionId,
             long blockId)
               throws BlockDoesNotExistException
        Obtains a read lock the block.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The id of the client
        blockId - The id of the block to be locked
        Returns:
        the lockId that uniquely identifies the lock obtained
        Throws:
        BlockDoesNotExistException - if blockId cannot be found, for example, evicted already.

      • moveBlock

        public void moveBlock(long sessionId,
             long blockId,
             int tierAlias)
               throws BlockDoesNotExistException,
                      BlockAlreadyExistsException,
                      InvalidWorkerStateException,
                      WorkerOutOfSpaceException,
                      IOException
        Moves a block from its current location to a target location, currently only tier level moves are supported
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The id of the client
        blockId - The id of the block to move
        tierAlias - The tier to move the block to
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if tierAlias is out of range of tiered storage
        BlockDoesNotExistException - if blockId cannot be found
        BlockAlreadyExistsException - if blockId already exists in committed blocks of the newLocation
        InvalidWorkerStateException - if blockId has not been committed
        WorkerOutOfSpaceException - if newLocation does not have enough extra space to hold the block
        IOException - if block cannot be moved from current location to newLocation

      • readBlock

        public String readBlock(long sessionId,
               long blockId,
               long lockId)
                 throws BlockDoesNotExistException,
                        InvalidWorkerStateException
        Gets the path to the block file in local storage. The block must be a permanent block, and the caller must first obtain the lock on the block.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The id of the client
        blockId - The id of the block to read
        lockId - The id of the lock on this block
        Returns:
        a string representing the path to this block in local storage
        Throws:
        BlockDoesNotExistException - if the blockId cannot be found in committed blocks or lockId cannot be found
        InvalidWorkerStateException - if sessionId or blockId is not the same as that in the LockRecord of lockId

      • readBlockRemote

        public BlockReader readBlockRemote(long sessionId,
                          long blockId,
                          long lockId)
                            throws BlockDoesNotExistException,
                                   InvalidWorkerStateException,
                                   IOException
        Gets the block reader for the block. This method is only called by a data server.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The id of the client
        blockId - The id of the block to read
        lockId - The id of the lock on this block
        Returns:
        the block reader for the block
        Throws:
        BlockDoesNotExistException - if lockId is not found
        InvalidWorkerStateException - if sessionId or blockId is not the same as that in the LockRecord of lockId
        IOException - if block cannot be read

      • removeBlock

        public void removeBlock(long sessionId,
               long blockId)
                 throws InvalidWorkerStateException,
                        BlockDoesNotExistException,
                        IOException
        Frees a block from Tachyon managed space.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The id of the client
        blockId - The id of the block to be freed
        Throws:
        InvalidWorkerStateException - if blockId has not been committed
        BlockDoesNotExistException - if block cannot be found
        IOException - if block cannot be removed from current path

      • requestSpace

        public void requestSpace(long sessionId,
                long blockId,
                long additionalBytes)
                  throws BlockDoesNotExistException,
                         WorkerOutOfSpaceException,
                         IOException
        Request an amount of space for a block in its storage directory. The block must be a temporary block.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The id of the client
        blockId - The id of the block to allocate space to
        additionalBytes - The amount of bytes to allocate
        Throws:
        BlockDoesNotExistException - if blockId can not be found, or some block in eviction plan cannot be found
        WorkerOutOfSpaceException - if requested space can not be satisfied
        IOException - if blocks in EvictionPlan fail to be moved or deleted on file system

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the block data manager. This method should only be called when terminating the worker.

      • unlockBlock

        public void unlockBlock(long lockId)
                 throws BlockDoesNotExistException
        Relinquishes the lock with the specified lock id.
        Parameters:
        lockId - The id of the lock to relinquish
        Throws:
        BlockDoesNotExistException - if lockId cannot be found

      • unlockBlock

        public void unlockBlock(long sessionId,
               long blockId)
                 throws BlockDoesNotExistException
        Throws:
        BlockDoesNotExistException

      • sessionHeartbeat

        public void sessionHeartbeat(long sessionId,
                    List<Long> metrics)
        Handles the heartbeat from a client.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The id of the client
        metrics - The set of metrics the client has gathered since the last heartbeat

      • updatePinList

        public void updatePinList(Set<Long> pinnedInodes)
        Set the pinlist for the underlying blockstore. Typically called by PinListSync.
        Parameters:
        pinnedInodes - a set of pinned inodes

        public FileInfo getFileInfo(long fileId)
                     throws IOException
        Gets the file information.
        Parameters:
        fileId - the file id
        Returns:
        the file info
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
